[[Great Lands]] | affiliation= | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | heritage= | parentage=[[Golfinweg]] | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Fingolfin]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Gelmir''' was the son of [[Golfinweg]], the first [[Gnomes|Gnome]] King, according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'' and ''[[The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]''.{{PE|15}}, "[[Index of Names for The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]", entries '''Turgon''' & '''Feanor''', p. 63 == History == Following his father's death, Gelmir led the Gnomes to the [[Great Lands]]. He was slain in the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears#Other versions of the legendarium|Battle of Unnumbered Tears]], and his son [[Fingolfin]] died trying to save [[Fëanor]], who was caught and tortured after the battle. Only [[Turgon]], Gelmir's grandson, along with a remnant of his people, as well as the [[sons of Fëanor]], managed to escape from the battle.{{PE|15}}, "[[Index of Names for The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]", entry '''Nínin Unothradin''', p. 61 == Etymology == The name ''Gelmir'' is in [[Noldorin]], but its meaning is unclear. Its [[Qenya]] cognate is '''''Nelmer'''''. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | GOL |GOL=[[Golfinweg]]}} {{familytree | |!| }} {{familytree | GEL |GEL='''GELMIR'''}} {{familytree | |!| }} {{familytree | FIN |FIN=[[Fingolfin]]}} {{familytree | |!| |}} {{familytree | TUR |TUR=[[Turgon]]}} {{familytree/end}} == Other versions of the legendarium == The name ''Gelmir'' was also applied to [[Finwë]], the first king of the Gnomes, at several points in the legendarium.{{PE|15}}, "[[Index of Names for The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]", p. 60{{SM|P2}}, p. 8 {{references}} {{title}} [[Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales]] [[Category:Gnomes]] [[Category:Noldorin names]] [[Category:Rulers in the Great Lands]]
